statements.name: PROC CORR
statements.description: The CORR procedure computes Pearson correlation coefficients, three nonparametric measures of association, and the probabilities associated with these statistics. The correlation statistics include the following: † o Pearson product-moment correlation o Spearman rank-order correlation o Kendall’s tau-b coefficient o Hoeffding’s measure of dependence, D o Pearson, Spearman, and Kendall partial correlation

arguments.name: ALPHA
arguments.description: Calculates and prints Cronbach’s coefficient α.

arguments.name: BEST=
arguments.description: Prints the n highest correlation coefficients for each variable, n ≥ 1.

arguments.name: BIASADJ=
arguments.description: Specifies whether or not the bias adjustment is used in constructing confidence limits.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: Specifies that the bias adjustment is used in constructing confidence limits.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: Specifies that the bias adjustment is not used in constructing confidence limits.

arguments.name: COV
arguments.description: Displays the variance and covariance matrix.

arguments.name: CSSCP
arguments.description: Displays a table of the corrected sums of squares and crossproducts.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: Names the SAS data set to be analyzed by PROC CORR.

arguments.name: EXCLNPWGT
arguments.description: Excludes observations with nonpositive weight values from the analysis.

arguments.name: FISHER
arguments.description: Requests use of Fisher’s transformation. The following fisher-options are available: ALPHA= specifies the level of the confidence limits for the correlation, 100(1-α)%. The value of the ALPHA= option must be between 0 and 1, and the default is ALPHA=0.05. BIASADJ=YES | NO specifies whether or not the bias adjustment is used in constructing confidence limits. RHO0=ρ0 specifies the value ρ0 in the null hypothesis Ho: ρ=ρ0, where -1 < ρ0 < 1. By default, RHO0=0.

arguments.name: HOEFFDING
arguments.description: Requests a table of Hoeffding’s statistics.

arguments.name: KENDALL
arguments.description: Requests a table of Kendall’s τ-b coefficients based on the number of concordant and discordant pairs of observations.

arguments.name: NOCORR
arguments.description: Suppresses displaying of Pearson correlations.

arguments.name: NOMISS
arguments.description: Excludes observations with missing values from the analysis.

arguments.name: NOPRINT
arguments.description: Suppresses all displayed output, which also includes output produced with ODS Graphics.

arguments.name: NOPROB
arguments.description: Suppresses displaying the probabilities associated with each correlation coefficient.

arguments.name: NOSIMPLE
arguments.description: Suppresses printing simple descriptive statistics for each variable.

arguments.name: OUTH=
arguments.description: Creates an output data set containing Hoeffding’s statistics.

arguments.name: OUTK=
arguments.description: Creates an output data set containing Kendall correlation statistics.

arguments.name: OUTP=
arguments.description: Creates an output data set containing Pearson correlation statistics.

arguments.name: OUTS=
arguments.description: Creates an output data set containing Spearman correlation coefficients.

arguments.name: PEARSON
arguments.description: Requests a table of Pearson product-moment correlations. The correlations range from -1 to 1.

arguments.name: PLOTS=
arguments.description: Syntax: PLOTS<(ONLY)><= plot-request> PLOTS <(ONLY)><=(plot-request < ...plot-request> ) > Requests statistical graphics via the Output Delivery System (ODS. The global plot option ONLY suppresses the default plots, and only plots specifically requested are displayed. The plot request options include the following: ALL produces all appropriate plots. MATRIX <( matrix-options )> requests a scatter plot matrix for variables. The available matrix-options are as follows: HIST | HISTOGRAM displays histograms of variables in the VAR list in the symmetric matrix plot. NVAR=ALL | n specifies the maximum number of variables in the VAR list to be displayed in the matrix plot, where n > 0. The NVAR=ALL option uses all variables in the VAR list. By default, NVAR=5. NWITH=ALL | n specifies the maximum number of variables in the WITH list to be displayed in the matrix plot, where n > 0. The NWITH=ALL option uses all variables in the WITH list. By default, NWITH=5. NONE suppresses all plots. SCATTER <( scatter-options )> requests scatter plots for pairs of variables. The available scatter-options are as follows: ALPHA=α specifies the α values for the confidence or prediction ellipses to be displayed in the scatter plots, where 0 < α < 0. By default, α=0.05. ELLIPSE=PREDICTION | CONFIDENCE | NONE requests prediction ellipses for new observations (ELLIPSE=PREDICTION), confidence ellipses for the mean (ELLIPSE=CONFIDENCE), or no ellipses (ELLIPSE=NONE) to be created in the scatter plots. By default, ELLIPSE=PREDICTION. NOINSET suppresses the default inset of summary information for the scatter plot. NVAR=ALL | n specifies the maximum number of variables in the VAR list to be displayed in the plots, where n > 0. The NVAR=ALL option uses all variables in the VAR list. By default, NVAR=5.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: Produces all appropriate plots.

arguments.name: MATRIX
arguments.description: Requests a scatter plot matrix for variables. The available matrix-options are as follows: HIST | HISTOGRAM displays histograms of variables in the VAR list in the symmetric matrix plot. NVAR=ALL | n specifies the maximum number of variables in the VAR list to be displayed in the matrix plot, where n > 0. The NVAR=ALL option uses all variables in the VAR list. By default, NVAR=5. NWITH=ALL | n specifies the maximum number of variables in the WITH list to be displayed in the matrix plot, where n > 0. The NWITH=ALL option uses all variables in the WITH list. By default, NWITH=5.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Suppresses all plots.

arguments.name: SCATTER
arguments.description: Requests scatter plots for pairs of variables. The available scatter-options are as follows: ALPHA=α specifies the α values for the confidence or prediction ellipses to be displayed in the scatter plots, where 0 < α < 0. For each α value specified, a (1 - α) confidence or prediction ellipse is created. By default, α=0.05. ELLIPSE=PREDICTION | CONFIDENCE | NONE requests prediction ellipses for new observations (ELLIPSE=PREDICTION), confidence ellipses for the mean (ELLIPSE=CONFIDENCE), or no ellipses (ELLIPSE=NONE) to be created in the scatter plots. By default, ELLIPSE=PREDICTION. NOINSET suppresses the default inset of summary information for the scatter plot. The inset table contains the number of observations (Observations) and correlation. NVAR=ALL | n specifies the maximum number of variables in the VAR list to be displayed in the plots, where n > 0. The NVAR=ALL option uses all variables in the VAR list. By default, NVAR=5. NWITH=ALL | n specifies the maximum number of variables in the WITH list to be displayed in the plots, where n > 0. The NWITH=ALL option uses all variables in the WITH list. By default, NWITH=5.

arguments.name: RANK
arguments.description: Displays the ordered correlation coefficients for each variable.

arguments.name: SINGULAR=
arguments.description: Specifies the criterion for determining the singularity of a variable if you use a PARTIAL statement.

arguments.name: SPEARMAN
arguments.description: Requests a table of Spearman correlation coefficients based on the ranks of the variables.

arguments.name: SSCP
arguments.description: Displays a table of the sums of squares and crossproducts.

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: Specifies the type of confidence limits.

arguments.name: LOWER
arguments.description: Requests a lower confidence limit from the lower alternative.

arguments.name: UPPER
arguments.description: Requests a upper confidence limit from the upper alternative.

arguments.name: TWOSIDED
arguments.description: Requests two-sided confidence limits from the two-sided alternative.

arguments.name: VARDEF=
arguments.description: Specifies the divisor to use in the calculation of variances and covariances.

arguments.name: DF
arguments.description: Degrees of freedom

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: Number of observations

arguments.name: WDF
arguments.description: Sum of weights minus one

arguments.name: WEIGHT
arguments.description: Sum of weights

statements.name: BY
statements.description: Obtains separate analyses for each BY group.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: Specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.

arguments.name: NOTSORTED
arguments.description: Specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order.

statements.name: FREQ
statements.description: Lists a numeric variable whose value represents the frequency of the observation.

statements.name: ID
statements.description: Specifies one or more additional tip variables to identify observations in scatter plots and scatter plot.

statements.name: PARTIAL
statements.description: Lists variables to use in the calculation of partial correlation statistics.

statements.name: VAR
statements.description: Lists variables for which to compute correlation coefficients.

statements.name: WEIGHT
statements.description: Lists weights to use in the calculation of Pearson weighted product-moment correlation.

statements.name: WITH
statements.description: Lists variables with which correlations of the VAR statement variables are to be computed.
